DataElement.preferredName: Physician Diagnosed Hepatitis C Positive Finding Personal Medical History Yes No Not Applicable Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to signify whether a physician has diagnosed Hepatitis C in a patient.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Physician Diagnosed Hepatitis C Positive Finding Personal Medical History
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A doctor; a person who has been educated, trained, and licensed to practice the art and science of medicine; a practitioner of medicine, as contrasted with a surgeon._The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation._An RNA virus, causes non-A and non-B Hepatitis and liver cancer_An observation confirming something, such as the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism.__an account of all medical events and problems a person has experienced.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A doctor; a person who has been educated, trained, and licensed to practice the art and science of medicine; a practitioner of medicine, as contrasted with a surgeon. :The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.:An RNA virus, causes non-A and non-B Hepatitis and liver cancer

Concepts.definition: A doctor; a person who has been educated, trained, and licensed to practice the art and science of medicine; a practitioner of medicine, as contrasted with a surgeon.

The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.
A viral infection caused by the hepatitis C virus.

Property.preferredDefinition: An observation confirming something, such as the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism.:A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

Concepts.definition: A finding of abnormality following an examination or observation confirming something, such as the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism.
A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

ConceptualDomain.preferredName: Chronic or Associated Diseases and Exposures
ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: chronic diseases, as well as diseases and exposures associated with cancer.

DataElementConcept.origin: ECOG CRF:Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ReferenceDocuments.name: BPV - Has the participant been diagnosed with Hepatitis C
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the participant been diagnosed with Hepatitis C

ReferenceDocuments.name: ECOG CRF
ReferenceDocuments.description: Known hepatitis C virus (HCV) infection, chronic or active

ReferenceDocuments.name: Alternate Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient positive for hepatitis C virus?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the HCV viral load undetectable?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF TEXT 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of Hepatitis C?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CCTG_03
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has either a history of hepatitis C virus (HCV) infection and has been treated and cured, or has active HCV and is currently being treated with an undetectable viral load within 28 days of enrollment.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CCTG_01
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient is infected with hepatitis C virus (HCV) and has a detectable viral load.

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient positive for hepatitis C virus (HCV) antibody?

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated to support NCI CCR clinical trial for Anakinra in pustular dermatoses.
